intro: Cyphostemma haumanii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Cyphostemma haumanii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing along fences or trees in its natural habitat.
